com.github.katjahahn.tools

Class FileScoring

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.katjahahn.tools.FileScoring

  • public class FileScoring
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides file scoring based on statistical information about PE files. Only anomaly statistics are used at present.

    • Constructor Summary

      • apply

        public static FileScoring apply(java.io.File file)

      • fileScore

        public double fileScore()
        Calculates a file score based on anomalies and their BScores. The higher the score, the more likely we have a malicious file. A negative score indicates a non-malicious file. A positive score indicates a malicious file. A score of zero means there is no information whatsoever.
        Returns:
        the file's score based on its anomalies

      • scoreParts

        public java.util.Map<AnomalySubType,java.lang.Object> scoreParts()

      • _scoreParts

        public scala.collection.immutable.Map<AnomalySubType,java.lang.Object> _scoreParts()

      • malwareProbability

        public double malwareProbability()
        Calculates the probability for a file to be malicious based on the anomalies found in the file.

        Returns:
        probability P(BAD|Anomalies)
